responses.rationale: Factual reporting of scale ('third-largest infected flock', 'more than 1.1 million chickens') without explicit framing cues.
Factual question, no explicit framing cues present.
Factual reporting of a severe statistic ('Nearly 50 million birds died') without explicit framing cues.
Reports a reaction ('raised concerns') neutrally, not coupled with vivid intensifier or concrete scale of harm.
Factual reporting of a severe statistic ('More than 15 million... have been killed') without explicit framing cues.
Factual reporting of spread and consequence; 'highly contagious' is technical; 'swept across' describes reach, not realised impact.
Factual reporting of impact and consequences; 'particularly hard hit' describes degree of impact, not explicit alarmist framing.
Factual description of virus characteristics; 'highly contagious' and 'deadly' are technical terms; 'can prey on' describes potential action.
Factual description of spread mechanism and containment difficulty ('difficult to contain') without explicit framing.
Factual description of symptoms ('sudden increase in the mortality') without explicit framing cues.
Factual reporting of historical context and statistics ('infected hundreds of people') without explicit framing cues.
Contains a bare negation ('not unexpected') leading to a Neutral frame.
Factual reporting of potential economic impact ('impose a burden', 'already-onerous costs') using descriptive language, not explicit framing.
Factual reporting of a consequence ('have halted imports') without explicit framing cues.
Factual reporting of observed trend ('more geographic spread') without explicit framing cues.
Factual question, no explicit framing cues present.
Factual reporting of spread mechanism ('can contribute to spreading') without explicit framing cues.
Factual reporting of spread mechanism ('So can... having contact') without explicit framing cues.
Factual description of symptoms ('complete paralysis', 'swelling', 'twisting') without explicit framing cues.
Factual reporting of detection and potential outcome ('posing a likely threat') without explicit framing cues.
